name: T2
extended_description: Temperature of the air 2 meters above Earth's surface . This is the measure of air temperature used for most modeling applications.

name: TOT_PRECIP
extended_description: Total precipitation. Computed by summing total gridscale precipitation and total cumulus precipitation.

name: REL_HUMIDITY
extended_description: The amount of water vapor (i.e. moisture) in the air, relative to the amount of water vapor needed to saturate the air at the same air temperature and pressure. Expressed as a percentage.

name: WIND_MAG
extended_description: Wind speed at 10 meters above the Earth's surface. Computed by taking the vector magnitude of the west-east (u) component of wind and the north-south (v) component of wind.

name: PSFC
extended_description: Air pressure at Earth's surface.

name: SNOWNC
extended_description: Total precipitation in the form of snow and ice.

name: Q2
extended_description: The ratio of the mass of water vapor over the mass of dry air, measured 2 meters above Earth's surface.

name: TSK
extended_description: Temperature of the Earth's surface (ground surface).

name: U10
extended_description: Wind coming from the west, measured at 10 meters above Earth's surface. By covention, wind coming from the east is negative.

name: V10
extended_description: Wind coming from the north, measured at 10 meters above Earth's surface. By convention, wind coming from the south is negative.

name: RAINC
extended_description: Any form of precipitation (rain, snow, etc.) that is produced specifically by cumulus/cumulonimbus clouds. These are generally small clouds that bring heavy precipitation.

name: RAINNC
extended_description: Any form of precipitation (rain, snow, etc.) captured by the model resolution (i.e. 45km). Small clouds (including cumulus clouds) typically are excluded from this.

name: SWDDIF
extended_description: The portion of the total incoming solar radiation that has been scattered (by the atmosphere, clouds, etc.) before reaching the Earth’s surface.

name: LWDNB
description: Instantaneous downwelling longwave flux at bottom
extended_description: Longwave radiation emitted by Earth's surface that is reflected back downwards by clouds.

name: LWDNBC
description: Instantaneous downwelling clear sky longwave flux at bottom
extended_description: Longwave radiation emitted by Earth's surface that is reflected back downwards by the atmosphere, excluding the effect of clouds.

name: LWUPB
description: Instantaneous upwelling longwave flux at bottom
extended_description: Total amount of longwave radiation outputted by Earth's surface.

name: LWUPBC
description: Instantaneous upwelling clear sky longwave flux at bottom
extended_description: Longwave radiation emitted by Earth's surface that passes through the atmosphere (i.e. is not reflected back to the surface or absorbed by the atmosphere).

name: SWDNB
description: Instantaneous downwelling shortwave flux at bottom
extended_description: Shortwave radiation from the sun that reaches Earth's surface, minus radiation reflected back to space by clouds or absorbed by the atmosphere.

name: SWDNBC
description: Instantaneous downwelling clear sky shortwave flux at bottom
extended_description: Shortwave radiation from the sun that reaches Earth's surface.

name: SWUPB
description: Instantaneous upwelling shortwave flux at bottom
extended_description: Shortwave radiation from the sun that is reflected by Earth's surface, some of which may be reflected back downwards by clouds (i.e. not reflected back to space).

name: SWUPBC
description: Instantaneous upwelling clear sky shortwave flux at bottom
extended_description: Shortwave radiation from the sun that is reflected by Earth's surface back to space.
